subtitle: Hello everyone, welcome back to the channel, i want to share a shamanic practice with you
that I learned some time ago; it involves going into the astral finding an object and waking
back up in the physical in order to go and seek it and retrieve it ~ the purpose of this practice is to
find power, power in a shamanic spiritual sense, and more specifically; to experience
what shamans call 'Dreaming Awake', in other words, to be consciously in the dream--astral
state while awake so more on this later, so i'm going to explain how to do it, the significance
of it and also share my own experience of it, which for those of you who are interested in
confirming or validating experiences this is naturally one of those, however this practice
is not about confirming experiences, it's so much more than that, actually if a shaman gave you
this practice and you told him the only reason you want to do it is in order to confirm the
genuineness and validity of an experience he would just look at you like "who are you, you buffoon?"
he would just be utterly confused at your way of thinking because of course
every experience for a shaman is already you know a confirming experience you know ever since
my first experience i've never really cared for confirming experiences in some sort of scientific
method or something because the authentic out of body experience is a confirmation in itself
in the most profound sense of the direct experience of it, there is no doubt in
your mind when it happens, once you're out of body you're in the realm of knowledge not the realm of
intellectual speculation and there's a deep knowing here that goes beyond
any description that i could use with words right, so shamanism was actually one of the first
fields you could say of how i got into the world of the spirit right to talk in shamanistic terms i
really love the shamanistic intuition and perspective on things relating to reality and
the world itself, like many one of the very first books i read were the ones by Carlos Castaneda
which are all about him being an apprentice under a native American shaman called Don Juan Matus
after about a year after reading his books is when i met my Gnostic teacher, who, to my surprise
knew the shaman Don Juan Matus himself and his family - I'll leave a link in the description below
with Carlos Castaneda's books if you're interested... i also think a book called 'Chosen by the Spirits -
Following Your Shamanic Calling' is a good place to start too if you're really interested in getting
into shamanism, that book is more based upon Mongolian shamanism, but shamanism is shamanism
when we really understand the essence behind all these teachings throughout different religions
right, so after Carlos Castaneda was Don Juan's apprentice his next apprentice was someone called
Merilyn Tunneshende ~ if you liked Carlos Castaneda's books, I highly recommend
Merilyn's, they're basically a more enlightened version of Carlos's books which get straight
to the point of hers and Don Juan's wisdom-filled talks with various other shamans and medicine
men and women that she met, along with practices that she provides in the books
so just one of those practices is called 'Bridge Dreaming' which is what I'm going to show you today
this particular practice is from her book called 'Don Juan & the Art of Sexual Energy - The Rainbow
Serpent of the Toltecs' you can see the book cover here on the screen now, so one thing i
need to make clear is that in native American shamanism and many other shamanistic traditions:
in the realm of knowledge of dreaming and Astral projection there is actually very little
specifications or conceptual differentiations between Astral projection and dreaming - this is
because for the shaman he or she is awake in the full sense of the word 'awake' and therefore they
are not concerned with, or obsessed about, separate concepts of astral projection and dreaming like
so many of us are right? if you don't understand what i mean about being awake in the full sense
of the word check out my video called 'Lucid Dreaming vs Astral Projection' which is
on the screen now, that video has the awakening of consciousness at the basis of understanding this...
so in essence all dreaming for shamans is astral projection and people who have regular dreams,
us, are just like delusional people who are not awake to other realities right so when i talk
about shamanistic dreaming i'm talking about the fact that shamans understand the dream world as
not something illusory or filled with fantasies right, they connect with the astral realities
which is through dreaming but in shamanistic terminology this dreaming
is better said or written with a capital 'D' right? So let me clarify a little further; so shamanistic
dreaming is not regular dreaming like all of us regular ordinary people have
shamanistic dreaming isn't about being obsessed about scientifically validating experiences
or something, basically because their experiences already have validity and objectivity to them
dreaming for them is a way to experience visions of the future, or deeper realities, maybe vision
quests right? to undertake mystical journeys of learning, to gain wisdom, to understand how to heal,
to learn about aspects of nature, or to understand a plant or spirit animal, or something right?
for example if a medicine man or healer didn't know how to heal a person they would quote-on-quote
"Dream" the cure and find the correct plant and find the procedure they need to do to extract the
plant and figure out how to administer it to the sick person; they would gain all of that knowledge
from "Dreaming" in other words from the Astral, a lot of tribes around the world and throughout history
use this technique, of course in modern common astral projection perspectives this is interpreted
as them going into the Astral and finding out knowledge in a sort of natural Akashic records way
right? so i personally much prefer this more purer way of understanding our non-physical experiences
but of course we do have unconscious dreams and we have unconscious psychological patterns that
don't coincide with reality right? so even though i personally really much prefer the more purer
way of understanding this non-physical dimension that we all access every night
i know that of course it is also absolutely necessary to have these two different terms
of dreaming and astral projection, and especially of course for the purpose of teaching and sharing
this knowledge in the modern world in a more quantifiable way for everyone to understand
so that we can differentiate these two experiences, and you know that's why it's so difficult for so
many to understand the difference between lucid dreaming and astral projection
because to really understand it you have to understand your own delusions of the world,
so you know if you're still confused about what i'm talking about please check out my video called
lucid dreaming versus astral projection, i believe it's my most viewed video so it shouldn't be hard
to find, and probably check out some of my other videos too i do touch on that topic here and there
so i just wanted to lay some foundation there that shamans understand dreaming essentially
in the same way we understand astral projection so this practice of bridge dreaming really could
be called "astral bridging" right? so if a shaman ever mysteriously says to you "I dreamt of you"
he most likely actually saw you in the astral and maybe even know something about you; this is
because the shaman, if he really is an authentic one, he does not dream like ordinary people do,
dreaming in our usual ordinary unconscious sense, in traditional psychological terms, right? or better
said he doesn't daydream and live his life in petty thoughts or random fantasies - he is connected
to reality, and what happens when you go to sleep at night and are absolutely free from unconscious
egoic dreams? well, you enter and access this realm of knowledge right, in other words the astral,
a person who does this and has traversed this path for many years and decades is someone who
shamans would call: A Man of Knowledge ~ there's a good youtube video with an excerpt
on Don Juan talking about the four natural enemies of a man of knowledge, i'll leave it
in the description below go ahead and listen to it after this if you're interested, so now that
i've given a brief explanation of all that, and the shamanistic perspective and terminology of astral
projection, let's go into the actual practice, i've taken a picture from the book itself and will put
it on the screen for you it's a five-step guide then i'll talk about the experience i had with it
just before i do i just want to give a shout out to Gabby who pledged more than i offer on patreon
and also Quinton who chose the higher amount as well so people choosing to give more than
three dollars is really appreciated, everyone gets the same benefits, but you lot giving more, it
means a lot, i feel the love, so thank you and i hope you enjoy our meetings in the discord server
if you're also interested in supporting the channel and my future books i have about
three books planned now so if you are interested in supporting, please check out the link in the
description below, and so here's the practice on the screen it's the very first practice in the
book, so let's see here, number one: set up is the intent to be lucid within your dream
that is; to realize that you are dreaming while in the midst of it say to yourself over
and over as you fall asleep "i will realize that i am dreaming during my dreams" (take note that
Dreaming has a capital 'D' right? it does not mean dreaming in the traditional psychological sense...)
select a cue such as your hands or the sound of your own voice to trigger the realization, say to
yourself each time i hear my own voice or see my hands, i will realize that i'm dreaming, number two:
set a gentle alarm to awaken you after three hours of sleep and then every two hours following
awakening several times during the night enables you to have more recent recall of all dreaming
activity and set yourself to the task again, so basically waking up every two hours during the
night gives you a lot more chances to experience something significant at least at the minimum
number three: once you have attained frequent lucidity start looking for a pre-selected object
not in your possession, so something that you don't own, such as a smooth stone when you find that
particular object in dreaming begin the search for it in the waking world knowing that you will
succeed even though it may take time, this object has been signaled by power as an 'aid' to you, once
you find your objects of dreaming in the waking world you have successfully bridged, ask permission
of the energy to take the object home with you if this is possible, set it in a prominent place
so that you may see or feel it as you are falling asleep, if your object is a stone it may be secured
over your umbilical region by rolling it in a sash tied around your midriff, if it is not possible to
physically take what you have dreamed you may photograph it touch it or simply remember it
once you can bridge you may attempt to bridge anything; a place, a person, an idea, a power
something for the betterment of the world such as peace, the more you bridge, the more sure and
sturdy the foundation becomes until it is so strong that you may actually walk across it
into dreaming awake, in other words she's hinting that you may manifest these things in the waking
world whatever it may be, and if you've ever had an astral projection experience and felt some form
of tremendous energy, something profound that you wouldn't usually feel while ordinarily awaken the
physical, well then you're connecting to energies not of this world right? that's part of what the
shaman's journey is all about and why shamans can be viewed as strange or misinterpreted because
a lot of the time the energies that they carry are not of this ordinary world that we all know...
dreaming awake is the experience of bridging or feeling those same energies back in the physical
not just when we're asleep, there's far more to this of course it would maybe be better just to
tell you the story of my own experience of this which i had a few years ago - i originally tried
this practice around nine years ago with no luck and i remembered the practice again a few years
ago and i thought i'd read the book again and give it another try and it happened, it was a relatively
short experience ~ so with my intention set i fell asleep peacefully and at some point during the
night i found myself consciously out of body down a few roads away from where i was sleeping
it was night time just as it was in the real time of my physical body, i immediately had this
sense to walk in a certain direction on the pavement and without much thinking you know i just
started walking and eventually i stumbled across a tree this tree was on the pavement coming out of
the concrete, you know which is quite common in the UK, and at the bottom of the tree i was magnetized
to what was a somewhat large, smooth, light gray, a bit dirty, pebble which was about half the size of
my hand, and as i bent down to pick it up and hold it in my hand i just felt it and analyzed it for
a moment and as i did my whole energy began to shift and how can i explain it, my body dissolved,
it dissolved its atoms upwards into thin air as if i just evaporated, and as i did my whole awareness
transitioned into a mental space where at first it was just pure darkness and slowly i perceived
dancing geometric lights forming patterns together all around me, it's really hard to describe i wish
i could animate it because i have it so perfectly in my mind all the patterns, i was in a vast void
with only these lights, and the sensation was as if those lights were right in front of me but at the
same time they could have also been light years away from me which gave this sensation of pure
immensity and vastness, what's even harder to describe is the enlightening feeling that my mind
was being cleansed or washed as if cosmic rays were showering through me, just a sublime, beautiful
and opening experience really, i'm sure some of you have had similar experiences
in meditation perhaps and i have too but to experience it in this way is really, moving
and it's like when you get goosebumps from listening to beautiful inspirational music
but intensify those goosebumps by a hundred times going throughout your whole body and through this
invigoration i also felt this peace and fullness and being at one with everything, i was nothing yet
i was everything and endowed with this life force, after some time eventually i re-established back
into my physical body but what was still of utmost value to this experience is that i still
retained whatever power or state of being that i felt, it wasn't just my energy body now that was
pulsating with this energy but now my physical body was too and i laid in bed completely still
in this sort of Samadhi meditation for some time, and when i was ready i got up wrote the experience
down in my journal, invigorated with this new sensation - without clinging or attaching to that
sensation my tired because that's important right? that we don't seek or cling onto new sensations,
and i eventually uh gradually got ready to go outside to that same location on the street
where i found that pebble, which according to the shamanic teaching it was 'a gift from power itself',
and i don't doubt that because when i did walk back down that street to my, of course overwhelming--
it wasn't shock, but it was this overwhelming feeling of awe and my heart
just opening up to the fact that i was back in this exact location where my energy body
just was, and i picked up the stone held it in my hand in pure amazement trying to keep my composure
and excitement of the fact that i found this exact same rock, in the same location, on the same tree,
while also feeling and connecting to the energies that this rock had been a catalyst for just around
a couple of hours ago when i was in the astral with the rock, but now i was in the physical
with it and so i was Dreaming Awake... do i fully understand what power is inside the pebble? no, do
i claim that there is even any power in the pebble? no, do i know whether the power only works for me?
no i don't, you know do i claim to understand any of this experience that i had? not really, at
least not intellectually, and in a way that i can describe effectively for you, it was at its heart
a mystical experience, but, do i know that the experience was true and more authentic than most
of my experiences in the physical and influenced me and moved me to the core of my being? absolutely.
and that's all that matters right? i still have the same pebble on my altar today and i always recall
and connect with whatever dimension i came in touch with when i see it or touch it or if i need
some aid, so to speak, so as you can see that pebble now acts as a physical bridge
to the non-physical for me ~ a physical object for my consciousness to make a link to that wonderful
dimension as best as i can whenever i intend to, so why am i sharing this practice and experience with
you? i think there's quite a few of you who are open to such an experience and at the very least
it helps us to understand how we can interact and form relationships with the physical world
in intimate and profound ways like this, even with something as simple as a rock
you know all of this, astral projection um, it's not all just about the non-physical - remember
awakening consciousness is all about giving up unconscious dreaming and understanding ourselves
and reality deeper, naturally we don't just become more conscious of what's within but also without
so we also become conscious of the physical world too more okay and the physical world
is not just this boring and dead matter that conventional viewpoints make it seem
become aware of within and you become aware of what is outside too, as above so below, and
it's through this approach and understanding that we can start to intuit the reality of how certain
objects like crystals or rocks may have with this sort of subtle energy or power like this shamanic
teaching shows, or also perhaps you may even learn the reality of auras, or other energies, or plants
nature, animals ~ a reason why the wise people of tribes are always seen as being highly connected
with the nature: it's natural because they are so connected with their own inner nature and
not polluting their inner nature with delusions, psychological, obsessions, anger, lusts, desires of
this world etc right? they've renounced all of that in order to connect with what is beyond this world
well i hope you all found this interesting everyone... shamanism takes a very special
mindset to fully understand so if you have any questions please do feel free to ask below
I will eventually get back to you, this is Gene you're listening to Astral Doorway
and I will see you on the next episode.
